text: Aechmea napoensis is a species of plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is endemic to Ecuador.Kew World Checklist of Selected Plant Families Its natural habitats are subtropical or tropical moist lowland forests and subtropical or tropical moist montane forests. It is threatened by habitat loss.Manzanares, J.M. & Pitman, N. 2003. Aechmea napoensis. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 20 August 2007. ==References== Category:Flora of Ecuador napoensis Category:Near threatened plants Category:Plants described in 1980 Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Aechmea napoensis
